meanings.definition: The capacity or space for holding liquid in a tank.
meanings.sent1: The tankage of the reservoir is impressive.
meanings.sent2: The factory needs more tankage to store the excess water.
meanings.sent3: The competition for the limited tankage was fierce.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like tankage, holding all the tears she refused to shed.
meanings.sent5: The tankage of the ship was so vast, it seemed to stretch to the horizon.

meanings.definition: The act or process of storing or holding liquid in a tank.
meanings.sent1: Tankage is crucial for the smooth operation of the refinery.
meanings.sent2: The tankage of oil is carefully monitored to prevent leaks.
meanings.sent3: The tankage of the fuel was a well-orchestrated ballet of pipes and valves.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a tankage of memories, each one carefully stored and labeled.
meanings.sent5: The tankage of the water supply ensured there was always enough for everyone.
